instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1706 Touchbar , touchbar not active.
threads.message:
Hi i have an issue with A1706 13" 2016 Mac Pro. When installing Os it get to a point where it says "A critical software update is required for your mac, but an error was encountered" it just goes back to that. The touchbar doesnt seem to be working. I have inspected the board but cannot see any sign of spillage. It only works when internal video cable is removed then it boots into Os with touchbar working and video external
Would the screen/webcam be the issue or cable?

threads.title: A1706 Touchbar , touchbar not active.
threads.message:
ALS failure.
On these machines, you also lose webcam feature.
Disconnect the small connector for webcam and you can use internal LCD.

threads.title: A1706 Touchbar , touchbar not active.
threads.message:
Thank you, what does Als mean?

Is there a recall program for this issue?

threads.title: A1706 Touchbar , touchbar not active.
threads.message:
Ambient Light Sensor, installed in the webcam board.
No recall program for this :(

threads.title: A1706 Touchbar , touchbar not active.
threads.message: And definitely not anything to do with U3900?

threads.title: A1706 Touchbar , touchbar not active.
threads.message:
No :(
I try disabling only ALS lines, but macOS reports webcam error then...
